column3: We should never use an old tool when the extra labor in consequence costs more than a new one. Thousands wear out their lives and waste their time merely by the use of dull and unsuitable instruments.

column1: När det regnar manna från himlen har den fattige ingen sked.
column2: When it rains manna from heaven, the poor one does not have a spoon.

column1: När det regnar på prästen, så droppar det på klockaren.
column2: When it rains on the priest, it dripples on the sacristan.
column3: When someone is successful, his subordinates are a little better off as well.

column1: När fan blir gammal blir han religiös.
column2: When the devil grows old he turns religious.
column3: People often become more religious as they get closer to death. Also used metaphorically when people appear to change in self-serving ways.

column1: När Gud kommer med döden, kommer fan med arvingarna.
column2: When God brings death, the devil brings heirs.

column1: När man talar om trollen så står de i farstun och lyssnar.
När musen är mätt, smakar mjölet beskt.
column2: When the mouse is full, the flour tastes bitter.
column3: When you finally got something, you don’t appreciate it anymore.

column1: När nöden är som störst är hjälpen som närmast.
column2: When distress is the greatest, help is the nearest.

column1: När katten är borta dansar råttorna på bordet.
column2: When the cat’s away, the mice will play.
column3: In the absence of the person in authority those under his control will often neglect the duties/rules imposed on them.
It is acceptable to break rules in times of need.

column2: Necessity is the mother of invention.
